page.title: 09FARMING SURVEY part two
page.content: only one farm having a size greater than 300 acres showing intensive farming. Just over half of the farm holdings in the area are owned by the farmers themselves. Just over 20% were rented and just over 20% were owned and rented. The greatest percentage of employment is of a permanant nature, accounting for 62.5% of the total number of empolyees. The bulk of the remaining 38% is taken up by part time employment, while a small amount of labour is seasonal (12.5%). 87% of the farms have between 1 and 5 employees, and 12% have between 6 and 10 employees. When Britain joined the E.E.C. 71% of the farms in the area were affected by the sanctions put on the farms in the community.Some affects were to
